thread.title: Remember when Dot Cotton was in CORRIE? ITV share starling clip of EastEnders legend on the cobbles
thread.title_full: Remember when Dot Cotton was in CORRIE? ITV share starling clip of EastEnders legend on the cobbles

author: Lucy Mapstone
title: Remember when Dot Cotton was in CORRIE? ITV share starling clip of EastEnders legend on the cobbles
text:
Remember when Dot Cotton was in CORRIE? ITV share starling clip of EastEnders legend on the cobbles This footage from 1971 shows the Albert Square favourite during her time on the cobbles Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch: June stars in Corrie long before she was on Eastenders Share this video Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A rare throwback clip of EastEnders stalwart June Brown appearing in Coronation Street more than 45 years ago has been shared by the soap, leading the tributes on the veteran star's 90th birthday. 
While Brown is best known for appearing as Dot Cotton in the BBC's serial drama for over three decades , she had a minor role in the ITV soap in 1970 and 1971 as Mrs Parsons. 
To mark her landmark birthday, a short scene with Brown and on-screen son Tony Parsons (David Hill) and Weatherfield icon Ena Sharples (Violet Carson) was posted on the official Coronation Street Twitter account. Violet Carson (as Ena Sharples) and June Brown (as Mrs Parsons) (Photo: Rex Features) 
The accompanying tweet read: "Happy 90th birthday to soap legend June Brown. Before the @bbceastenders Square she graced the Street. Here's a look back to 1971. #Corrie." Read More 
Brown made three appearances as Mrs Parsons, whose son Tony received harmonium lessons from long-running character Ena. June played Mrs Parsons (Photo: wenn.com) June Brown in 'Coronation Street' (Photo: http://www.wenn.com/) 
She later went on to join the cast of EastEnders shortly after it began in 1985 and she has been a mainstay of the Walford-based soap ever since. 
Tributes poured in from Brown's EastEnders co-stars on the big day, with Ian Beale actor Adam Woodyatt declaring her "a legend". June Brown as Dot 
Jacqueline Jossa, who plays Lauren Branning in the soap, wrote: "Happy 90th birthday June brown. We love you so so much! @bbceastenders #legend." Read More 
Jack Branning actor Scott Maslen wrote: "I would just like to say what an absolute pleasure it is working with the legend that is June Brown! She never ceases to amaze me! Love you." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
